body.p: The Board believes that information from both perspectives assists users of financial statements in their analysis of an entity’s exposure to risk—the disclosures in IFRS 7 by identifying those financial instruments that create risk, and the disclosures in IFRS 12 by providing, when relevant, information about:

li.p: the extent of an entity’s transactions with structured entities;
concentrations of risk that arise from the nature of the entities with which the entity has transactions; and
particular transactions that expose the entity to risk.
